intro: Cracca densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically blooms in spring and produces small, red fruits that are edible for some bird species. Cracca densiflora thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens.
